content:
@Ted Klein
1) none of the +5 mentioned ICPC codesystems defined in UTG (https://terminology.hl7.org/codesystems.html) have any content (meaning: any codes listed).
2) Shouldn't at least the country specific codesystems (eg. https://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem-icpc-DAN.html) be listed as supplement codesystems to the base codesystem?
3) If I were to supply the danish codesystem suppplement with the actual danish designations, it would not be 100% efficient until the base codesystem has its codes filled out.
-or am I missing something here?
(I'm working on adding the code system with danish designations @ https://github.com/hl7dk/dk-core/blob/feature/icpc-supplement/input/resources/icpc2e-dk.xml)
@Jens Villadsen I'll try to answer:

1. As per HTA approved and TSC endorsed policy, NO code system published by an organization outside of HL7 will have codes published in THO UNLESS an explicit agreement to do so, and a process for maintaining current accurate content in the face of external updates is defined and documented;

1. All of those external code system metadata records you see that are in the category of "Other" (meaning not curated by HTA) are subject to imminent removal. This is as per an email that went out to all cochairs (I think probably not to the IC reps which was probably an oversight, please contact @Reuben Daniels about it). These were all imported and their fields assigned pro forma by the import algorithm from material published in the V3 coremif release December 2019. In almost 2 years no one has cleaned them up, so HTA sent a request for any that people wish to remain in THO be identified and cleaned up, all others will be removed next month. I am pretty sure all of those ICPC variants are among that pile. Note also that the way the variants are represented in FHIR differs from V3, which did not support the concept of code system supplements. Hence what you are seeing is the pro forma representation of the v3 model there. If you feel these should be part of the THO publication, please notify HTA to this effect, and please take on the task of fixing them.

1. See 1 and 2 above. Any code system that is not authored and maintained by HL7 through the UTG process must come through HTA, and content can only be put in there as per agreement, again through HTA. @Carol Macumber and @Reuben Daniels are the ones to contact about this.
@Ted Klein - thx for the explanation
Ill reach out to HTA on https://confluence.hl7.org/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=6001782#content/view/14746083

@Carol Macumber / @Reuben Daniels have you considered sending out the information the affiliates? Most of the work conducted in my country is done within the affiliate, not in the WG's. I'm aware that this might be an exception to how HL7 is organized but I encourage you to also dispatch such information to the affiliates.

@Carol Macumber / @Reuben Daniels I see that ICPC was on the agenda (https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TA/Teleconference+2022-02-10) have you come to a conclusion? I has been a couple of months now and looking at https://terminology.hl7.org/codesystems.html I still see a lot of what could look like deprecated/unused systems
@Ted Klein I have recieved permission from the caretakers of the danish ICPC to publish it. Should I forward that to THO?
I'm not sure that THO is the best place to publish. fhir.tx.support is also possible - what exactly is the permission?
@Roel Barelds has taken up this item for HTA. , Roel, can you provide a status.
@Grahame Grieve the abbreviated version is here: https://github.com/hl7dk/dk-core/issues/11 - I'm sure I can get @Michael Johansen to add some more details
and @Grahame Grieve if you don't mind having all kinds of different languages ending up in fhir.tx.support then sure

sure I don't mind - that's what it's for. Maybe better than THO since it has much lighter governance. but given that the permission is for Danish use, perhaps it would be better in the danish IG. Is it too big?
not at all - its around 1200 elements if I recall
The reason for taking this to THO is that it already contains stuff like https://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem-icpc-DAN.html
its empty though (and the previous deprecated version) - for reason unknown to me

well, that can't be the right URL. In fact, it's wrong: it can't claim to be the authoritative source and then not include content at all. I'll raise that on the terminology stream. So I'd make a THO task to remove that, and then add it to the dk base IG
They have more of those - like https://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem-icpc-GER.html
in fact ... I think all the ICPC codesystems are more or less empty regardless of version
(and yes ... I'll just add it to the danish core IG for now)
But @Grahame Grieve - as I see it, the danish ICPC is technically a supplement. It 'only' contains translations in regards to the origin
So I need to refer to the origin
what's the origin? Is it really only translations? because elsewhere I've seen more changes than just that
The origin of ICPC is found here: https://www.ehelse.no/kodeverk/icpc-2e--english-version
(im a bit surprised there are 'multiple' second editions ... :thinking: )
or versioned second editions ...
The danish translation contains 684 codes
and the latest â€‹ICPC-2e-v.7.0 20 february 2018 contains 686 codes as far as I can count
so yeah ... its probably only translations
Im not aware of any extra codes added in DK

I am not aware of differences between Danish and WONCA ICPC-2e other than translation english to danish. If the number of codes dont add up, it could possibly be the case, that a small add/not-use has taken place back in 2008. I can find out if you like. Lots of the versions of ICPC-2e is, as far as i can see, changes in the mapping to ICD10, and not changes to the ICPC-2e codes themself.
ok. so we could publish Danish ICPC as a supplement to the base ICPC, but we don't have permission to publish the base ICPC?
I requested permission through the danish org MedCom to get permission to use and publish the danish translations of ICPC
Since they were already listed on THO I assumed someone else already had requested permission for the english ones
So I cant answer your question in regards to the base ICPC
we have permission to say they exist, not to include the content. I won't be able to do anything with a supplement without the content
(content is here https://github.com/hl7dk/dk-core/blob/feature/icpc-supplement/input/resources/icpc2e-dk.xml)
